info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 6:59PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Reagan and southeastern Upton Counties through 745 PM CDT... At 659 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles east of Rankin, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Big Lake, Rankin, Reagan County Airport, Best and Stiles. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
